column1: ëalar is a Quenya word which referred to such Spirits (creatures) who did not require a body in order to be complete (like the Maiar). Eälar are contrasted with fëar
column2: which are the souls of beings whose natural state is to be incarnated in a body.

column1: The word is related to Quenya ëala ("being")
column2: and seems to be related to the Quenya verb Ea (verb) "be

column1: It has been suggested that -la is the present participle ending of verbs (cf. "-ing"; but Quenya -la only forms adjectival participles)Helge Fauskanger
